taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [based on epithet of Lycopodium phlegmaria ; Greek phlegma, flame, and oura, tail; in reference to the tasslelike fertile portions of the plant]

bio:treatment.discussion: As construed here, Phlegmariurus is very large and diverse. Many groups have been tentatively suggested in this genus (B. Ã˜llgaard 1987). Some of these ultimately may be recognized as subgenera or even genera.
